channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The virus hunters who search bat caves to predict the next pandemic
item.description: Before entering the cave, the small team of scientists pull on hazmat suits, face masks and thick gloves to cover every inch of their skin. Contact with bat droppings or urine could expose them to some of the world's deadliest unknown viruses.

item.title: An aggrieved Trump blames press for furor over disinfectant comments
CNN anchor: We have to report this, even though it's insane
item.description: CNN's Brian Stelter examines life during the coronavirus pandemic and how people in positions of power are handling it.

item.title: More than 2.9 million people infected with coronavirus worldwide
I left Hong Kong for a break. Instead I got stuck with my parents for weeks
item.description: I'm a 30-year-old woman and my dad has just told me to clean my room.

item.title: 'The food supply chain is breaking,' Tyson Foods says as plants close
item.description: Tyson Foods is warning that "millions of pounds of meat" will disappear from the supply chain as the coronavirus pandemic pushes food processing plants to close, leading to product shortages in grocery stores across the country.

item.title: Preliminary results from a remdesivir trial could come in a week or two
item.description: Preliminary results from a clinical trial of remdesivir, an experimental antiviral drug being tested for coronavirus, could come in as little as one to two weeks, a top researcher said Sunday.

item.title: While billionaires isolate in luxurious Mediterranean hideaways, Paris suburbs face surge in deaths
item.description: While billionaires isolate themselves at luxurious hideaways on the Mediterranean during the coronavirus outbreak, residents in deprived and crowded areas of France are now facing a surge in deaths, along with unrest on the streets.

item.title: Tapper: Trump's musings were there for all to see and hear
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper gives his take on President Donald Trump's dangerous suggestion during one of his White House briefings that ingesting disinfectant could kill the coronavirus.

item.title: Amid mounting speculation, South Korea says Kim Jong Un is 'alive and well'
People crowd California beaches despite coronavirus concerns
item.description: Relaxed restrictions and a record heat wave are sending crowds to some beaches in California amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: It's basically impossible to practice social distancing in Hong Kong's cage homes
'SNL' returns with Brad Pitt as Dr. Anthony Fauci
These workers lost their jobs. Now they're hustling to survive
item.description: The smell of red enchiladas and Peruvian lomo saltado filled the kitchen as Maria and Luis Ramirez cooked non-stop.

item.title: Some scientists are using sewage to measure the prevalence of coronavirus in their communities
item.description: As the need for widespread Covid-19 testing grows, officials are looking to flush out hidden cases of the virus by examining sewage.

item.title: What happened on board the last cruise ship still at sea
item.description: In January 2020, the gigantic Costa Deliziosa cruise ship slipped its moorings in the Italian city of Venice and headed out into the Adriatic Sea on an around-the-world voyage. Around 2000 passengers were on board for what they hoped would be the trip of a lifetime.

item.title: 75 years after Hiroshima, the symbolic assembly point of the atomic age sits ignored
item.description: It's a discolored concrete slab, molding in the tropical humidity. But on this slab, not much bigger than the footprint of a beach cabin, history changed.

item.title: Spanish soccer league delays Covid-19 tests for players, who ask that health workers be prioritized
item.description: Spain's top soccer league has informed clubs that testing for players for the coronavirus ahead of a return to training will be delayed.

item.title: New satellite images show Kim Jong Un's compound
item.description: Newly released satellite images show Kim Jong Un's compound in Wonsan, North Korea, as questions circulate about the state of the North Korean leader's health. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

item.title: Lifting lockdowns safely relies on testing. Germany is succeeding, as US flies blind
item.description: • Wary Germans hate sharing their data. Will they use a Covid-19 tracking app?

item.title: Shop owner plans to reopen despite call from governor's office
item.description: Parts of Colorado are beginning to lift coronavirus restrictions. CNN's Gary Tuchman speaks with a local barber shop owner who plans to reopen, despite the fact that the state told him not to.

item.title: Several Italian mafia bosses released from prison over coronavirus fears
item.description: Several Italian mafia bosses have been released from prison under a new coronavirus regulation, the country's national anti-mafia prosecutor said.

item.title: Working from home could shake up parenting dynamics
item.description: Millions of dads now working from home may spark the kind of generational change this researcher says could be bigger than World War II.

item.title: Students file class-action lawsuits, claiming schools failed to adequately refund fees
item.description: Class-action lawsuits have been filed against three New York universities by students who argue the schools have failed to adequately refund or reimburse students for tuition and other fees they paid to have in-person, on-campus classes and other activities.

item.title: 'Chernobyl Diaries' actor dies at 52
item.description: Actor Dimitri Diatchenko, best known as Uri on "Chernobyl Diaries," was found dead in his home in Daytona Beach, Florida, police say.

item.title: What a father tells his son born during a pandemic
item.description: CNN Correspondent Bill Weir shares video of the moment his son was born and reads a letter to him about the current state of the world.

item.title: 'Homeland' zeroes in on Carrie and Saul in a tense series finale
item.description: When Showtime renewed "Homeland" through an eighth season, the three-year extension offered the prospect of a big buildup and whiz-bang finish. What emerged fell short of that, culminating in a tense, high-stakes finale that still felt like a much-diminished show from the one whose debut rightfully earned awards, critical praise and President Obama's endorsement.

item.title: Kanye West is finally a billionaire, Forbes says. He sent a text to say it undervalued him
item.description: Kanye West has long coveted the title of "billionaire."

item.title: Astronomers find 'alien' asteroids living in our solar system
item.description: Scientists In the last few years have studied the first observed interstellar visitors to our solar system. They include a comet called 2I/Borisov, spotted in 2019 and still passing through, and an asteroid called 'Oumuamua that zipped through quickly in 2017.

item.title: Davido releases 'Dolce & Gabanna' music video and donates proceeds to coronavirus research
item.description: Nigerian singer, Davido, is doing his part in the fight against COVID-19.

item.title: Internet loses it over a bad tuna sandwich
item.description: Sen. Mark Warner looked to bring some levity to the public amid the coronavirus outbreak by sharing a cooking tutorial this week -- but even some of his colleagues decried his culinary choice as fishy and heavy-handed.

item.title: A family on the front lines
item.description: Dr. Rob Gore stands in the doorway of his Brooklyn brownstone.

item.title: Million-dollar whisky sale targeted in cyber attack, says auctioneer
item.description: The second phase of a million-dollar online whisky auction has been postponed after it became the target of a cyber attack, auctioneers have said.

item.title: Tampa mayor tries to make amends with Tom Brady in welcome letter
item.description: Tom Brady has had a few mishaps since moving to Tampa, Florida, so the mayor is trying to make nice with him.

item.title: How to tell if your pet is stressed and what you can do about it
item.description: Happy dogs chasing balls on their fourth walk of the day. Purring puffs of fluff who can't wait to snuggle with pet parents miraculously home all day. These are the images we may have of sheltering with our pets during the age of coronavirus.

item.title: New Orleans in the age of coronavirus is quiet and strange
item.description: Creativity is the underlying pulse that gives New Orleans life, not death, and it's in quarantine. Walking the streets and funky neighborhoods of New Orleans makes you crave the city's rhythmic heartbeat. This city is quiet, and without music dancing in the air, it's like Mardi Gras without bead-drenched parades. It just doesn't feel right.

item.title: Boeing terminates $4.2 billion deal with Embraer
item.description: Boeing has terminated its $4.2 billion deal with Brazilian aircraft maker Embraer, the American company announced Saturday. The deal would have given Boeing a bigger stake in the market for smaller jets and help the company develop airplanes more cheaply.

item.title: Trump administration points finger at China for attempts to steal coronavirus research
item.description: The Trump administration is pointing the finger at China for attempting to steal coronavirus research as officials are warning they have seen a growing wave of cyberattacks on US government agencies and medical institutions leading the pandemic response by nation states and criminal groups.

item.title: Mental health is 'a pandemic no one is talking about,' says NBA All-Star
item.description: NBA star Kevin Love keeps a Shakespeare quote in his notebook: "Things won are done, joy's soul lies in the doing."

item.title: First ever 'road map' of the moon released
item.description: The US Geological Survey released the first ever comprehensive lunar map with rock layers and craters charted in great detail.

item.title: We're in a golden age of TV re-runs. Soon it might be all we have
item.description: Nick Offerman never knew he was part of a TV juggernaut.

item.title: Bars collect money from walls for laid-off employees
item.description: Bars peel dollar bills off walls and ceilings to pay laid-off workers. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: Taylor Swift slams former record label for releasing new album
item.description: The longtime feud between Taylor Swift and her former record label has been reignited.

item.title: Rugby is in 'crisis' but this man thinks he can solve it
item.description: A plucky, abrasive presence on the rugby field, Agustin Pichot has never done things quietly -- a boldness he now carries into the game's boardrooms.

item.title: Writing about the dead during a pandemic: 'They are not a statistic or data point'
item.description: A few weeks ago, The Chicago Tribune had four reporters and a single editor working on obituaries.

item.title: Trump retreats from public view
37 NYPD members have died from coronavirus
Amid mounting speculation, South Korea says Kim Jong Un is 'alive and well'
You can catch virus more than once
Reviving America after Covid-19 will take years, not months
item.description: Does anyone really want a barber's fingers in their face right now?
